some tsuba were heated and this gave the plate a very smooth and shiny surface.  I do not recall this treatment on tsuba with inlay however.

Milt you over clean everything you touch and that is why the waxy shiny surface LOL.

John

  now I know there's a reason for all the bungoing going on.............

  seriously, I only observe that " clear mica look " on Onin/Yoshiro type 
  tsuba over the brass/iron surface.
  Next time in a sword show, check it out.

  milt
